segment.source: Using the App-V 5.0 Client Management Console
segment.target: Using the App-V 5.0 Client Management Console

segment.source: Using the App-V 5.0 Client Management Console
segment.target: Using the App-V 5.0 Client Management Console

segment.source: Using the App-V 5.0 Client Management Console
segment.target: Using the App-V 5.0 Client Management Console

segment.source: This topic provides information about how you can configure and manage the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: This topic provides information about how you can configure and manage the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: Modify App-V 5.0 client configuration
segment.target: Modify App-V 5.0 client configuration

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client has associated settings that can be configured to determine how the client will run in your environment.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client has associated settings that can be configured to determine how the client will run in your environment.

segment.source: You can manage these settings on the computer that runs the client or by using PowerShell or Group Policy.
segment.target: You can manage these settings on the computer that runs the client or by using PowerShell or Group Policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to modify the client using PowerShell or Group Policy configuration see, How to Modify Client Configuration by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information about how to modify the client using PowerShell or Group Policy configuration see, How to Modify Client Configuration by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client management console
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client management console

segment.source: You can obtain information about the App-V 5.0 client or perform specific tasks by using the App-V 5.0 client management console.
segment.target: You can obtain information about the App-V 5.0 client or perform specific tasks by using the App-V 5.0 client management console.

segment.source: Many of the tasks that you can perform in the client management console you can also perform by using PowerShell.
segment.target: Many of the tasks that you can perform in the client management console you can also perform by using PowerShell.

segment.source: The associated PowerShell cmdlets for each action are also displayed in the following table.
segment.target: The associated PowerShell cmdlets for each action are also displayed in the following table.

segment.source: For more information about how to use PowerShell, see Administering App-V by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information about how to use PowerShell, see Administering App-V by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: The client management console contains the following described main tabs.
segment.target: The client management console contains the following described main tabs.

segment.source: Tab
segment.target: Tab

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Overview
segment.target: Overview

segment.source: The Overview tab contains the following elements:
segment.target: The Overview tab contains the following elements:

segment.source: Update – Use the Update tile to refresh a virtualized application or to receive a new virtualized package.
segment.target: Update – Use the Update tile to refresh a virtualized application or to receive a new virtualized package.

segment.source: The Last Refresh displays the current version of the virtualized package.
segment.target: The Last Refresh displays the current version of the virtualized package.

segment.source: Download all virtual applications – Use the Download tile to download all of the packages provisioned to the current user.
segment.target: Download all virtual applications – Use the Download tile to download all of the packages provisioned to the current user.

segment.source: (Associated PowerShell cmdlet: Mount-AppvClientPackage)
segment.target: (Associated PowerShell cmdlet: Mount-AppvClientPackage)

segment.source: Work Offline – Use this tile to disallow all automatic and manual virtual application updates.
segment.target: Work Offline – Use this tile to disallow all automatic and manual virtual application updates.

segment.source: (Associated PowerShell cmdlet: Set-AppvPublishServer –UserRefreshEnabled –GlobalRefreshEnabled)
segment.target: (Associated PowerShell cmdlet: Set-AppvPublishServer –UserRefreshEnabled –GlobalRefreshEnabled)

segment.source: Virtual Apps
segment.target: Virtual Apps

segment.source: The VIRTUAL APPS tab displays all of the packages that have been published to the user.
segment.target: The VIRTUAL APPS tab displays all of the packages that have been published to the user.

segment.source: You can also click a specific package and see all of the applications that are part of that package.
segment.target: You can also click a specific package and see all of the applications that are part of that package.

segment.source: This displays information about packages that are currently in use and how much of each package has been downloaded to the computer.
segment.target: This displays information about packages that are currently in use and how much of each package has been downloaded to the computer.

segment.source: You can also start and stop package downloads.
segment.target: You can also start and stop package downloads.

segment.source: Additionally, you can repair the user state.
segment.target: Additionally, you can repair the user state.

segment.source: A repair will delete all user data that is associated with a package.
segment.target: A repair will delete all user data that is associated with a package.

segment.source: App Connection Groups
segment.target: App Connection Groups

segment.source: The APP CONNECTION GROUPS tab displays all of the connection groups that are available to the current user.
segment.target: The APP CONNECTION GROUPS tab displays all of the connection groups that are available to the current user.

segment.source: Click a specific connection group to see all of the packages that are part of the selected group.
segment.target: Click a specific connection group to see all of the packages that are part of the selected group.

segment.source: This displays information about connection groups that are already in use and how much of the connection group contents have been downloaded to the computer.
segment.target: This displays information about connection groups that are already in use and how much of the connection group contents have been downloaded to the computer.

segment.source: Additionally, you can start and stop connection group downloads.
segment.target: Additionally, you can start and stop connection group downloads.

segment.source: You can use this section to initiate a repair.
segment.target: You can use this section to initiate a repair.

segment.source: A repair will remove all of the user state that is associated a connection group.
segment.target: A repair will remove all of the user state that is associated a connection group.

segment.source: (Associated PowerShell cmdlets: Download - Mount-AppvClientConnectionGroup.
segment.target: (Associated PowerShell cmdlets: Download - Mount-AppvClientConnectionGroup.

segment.source: Repair -AppvClientConnectionGroup.)
segment.target: Repair -AppvClientConnectionGroup.)

segment.source: How to Access the Client Management Console
segment.target: How to Access the Client Management Console

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
